node.title: US Secretary of State orders probe into 'Havana Syndrome'
node.alt: A headshot of Anthony Blinken as he testifies on Capitol Hill.
node.description: The US State Department has named a new coordinator for its investigation into cases of so-called Havana Syndrome, responding to increased pressure to investigate and respond to hundreds of brain injuries reported by diplomats and intelligence officers.
node.content:
["The US State Department has\u00a0named a new coordinator for its investigation into cases of so-called Havana Syndrome, responding to increased pressure\u00a0to investigate and respond to hundreds of brain injuries reported by diplomats and intelligence officers.", "Secretary of State Antony Blinken appointed a high-ranking deputy, Jonathan Moore, to coordinate the department's task force on the cases.", "Mr Moore replaces Pamela Spratlen, a retired diplomat temporarily called back into service by Mr Blinken before leaving in September.", "She had faced criticism from some victims.", "People affected have reported headaches, dizziness, nausea, and other symptoms consistent with traumatic brain injuries.", "Causes under consideration include the usage of a surveillance tool or a device intended to harm.", "The cases are known as Havana Syndrome\u00a0because they date back to a series of reported brain injuries in 2016 at the US\u00a0Embassy in Cuba.", "", "
Jonathan Moore replaces Pamela Spratlen who was criticised for her dealing of initial complaints from US personnel.(AP: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds/Pool)
", "Mr Blinken also appointed retired ambassador Margaret Uyehara to lead efforts to directly support care for State Department employees.", "Investigators have been studying a growing number of reported cases by US\u00a0personnel around the world and whether they are caused by exposure to microwaves or other forms of directed energy.", "Mr Blinken said the government would \"do all we can\" to address the \"threat posed by anomalous health incidents\".", "\"They've experienced serious physical consequences, including persistent headaches and hearing loss. They've also experienced psychological harm,\u00a0including trauma, anxiety, depression. They've been affected. Their careers have been affected,\" he said.", "\"This is an urgent priority for President Biden, for me, for our entire government. And we will do absolutely everything we can. Leaving no stone unturned to stop these occurrences as swiftly as possible.\"", "After years of investigation, the US\u00a0government has still not publicly identified what or who might be behind the incidents or whether they are, in fact, attacks.", "But leaders in the State and Defense departments and at the CIA have pushed employees to report possible brain injuries and in some cases removed leaders who were seen as unsympathetic to the cases.", "AP"]
